### About Bibscraper
Bibscraper is an open-source project that helps to check out prices of your favorite book from leading online bookstores and choose the cheapest one. Download the zip/tar version and follow the steps.
```
$ apt-get install scrapy
$ cd <extracted-folder>
$ scrapy deploy scrapysite -p scrapBib
$ scrapy crawl <crawler-name> -a isbn=<isbn_number>
```

<crawler-name> is one of flipkartspider , homeshop18spider or infibeamspider.

Make sure PYTHONPATH environmental variable is set correctly to your extracted folder.
Check out this [link](https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/scrapy-users/2U3Nm9aoPFo) for setting correct environmental variables while using scrapy.

If you need to use the UI, install php compatibile web server , say apache and point DOCUMENT_ROOT to <extracted_folder>/ui/ or do :
```
$ cd <extracted_folder>
$ cp -r ui/* /var/www/*

```
* Assuming /var/www is the DOCUMENT_ROOT and run http://localhost/bibscraper.html in browser.

### Miscellaneous
All crawlers are defined inside <extracted-folder>/scrapBib/spiders. Check out scrapy [documentation](http://scrapy.org/) to understand how to write crawlers better. Scraped data are JSON formatted currently. You can define your own pipelines. Make sure to add your pipelines to ITEM_PIPELINES in settings.py. Define pipeline classes in <extracted-folder>/scrapBib/pipelines.py. 

All UI related files are in <extracted-folder>/ui/. UI is written using the cool [Twitter bootstrap framework](http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap/).

scrapy server is assumed to run on 6800 port (default). If you are changing it, change it correspondingly in the curl request URLs in ui/fetchresults.php file too.

### Support or Contact
Want to report bugs/contribute ? Feel free to mail me at aravindhramu@gmail.com.
Thanks ! :)
